channel.title: Making a .class file
channel.description: Hi, i'm trying to implement a new highscores system to my website & in order to do so one of the steps involves creating highscores.class, how do I make a class file? Help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: Making a .class file
item.dc:creator: @Ags_Rush Ags Rush
item.description:
@Ags_Rush wrote:

Or just get the highscores code, write it out in text pad or so, then save and compile it in textpad. It should automatically give you a class file.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a .class file
item.dc:creator: @Kasparr Kasparr
item.description:
@Kasparr wrote:

Yes, I know how to make a .java file, and OH I was completely reading wrong. I thought it told me to save it as highscores.class and I was like well wth that isn’t doing anything. Thanks for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a .class file
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

A class file in java contains the byte code. Not your actual java code, often programmers refer to a .java file extension as a .class file, we don’t actually mean a .class file :p.

And to make a java file you create a new .txt document and then click save as and then save the file with a .java file extension.

Read full topic
